get.summary: Gets File From Minio With Original Content-Type
get.description:
Takes an id file and a bucket name and returns streaming file with
corresponding content-type.

    Args:

        id: int id of a file in minio
        bucket: a bucket name in minio
        original: determines file format. "false" for converted,
        and "true" for original

    Returns:

         Streaming file

get.summary: Get Thumbnail Of Original File In Jpg Format
Get Image Content With Provided Bbox

post.description:
Creates bucket into Minio. If bucket exists HTTPException will be
raised with status code 400. Status code 400 will be raised as well
if bucket name is less than 3 characters or name is invalid.

    Args:

        name: name for a new bucket

    Returns:

        result for creating bucket

    Raises:

        HTTPException status 400

Allows getting files metadata with filters, sorts and pagination.

    Args:

        request: a request to get files data, schema for this request
        generated automatically.

    Returns:

        an array of files metadata

schema.title: Response Searches For Files Files Search Post

post.description:
Provides uploading many files. Files are form-data.
Uploaded file goes to Minio storage with changed name and then
from the storage metadata about these files goes to a database.

    Args:

        x_current_tenant: current bucket in minio
        files: list of files to be uploaded

    Returns:

        Array of objects, each object contains fields: file_name,
        id, action, status and message. For example:

        [
            {
                "file_name": "A17_FlightPlan.pdf",
                "id": 1,
                "action": "upload",
                "status": true,
                "message": "Successfully uploaded"
          }
        ]

    Raises:

        HTTPException 404 code if bucket does not exist or 400 if bucket name
        less than 3 characters

schema.title: Response Uploads Files Into Minio Bucket Files Post

delete.description:
Deletes objects from minio storage and then their metadata from database.
If file does not exist in the bucket, then it will be skipped. The result for
each file will be written into resulting dict.

    Args:

        objects: list of object ids to be deleted

    Returns:

        Array of objects that contain a result for each element in objects arg

    Raises:

        HTTPException 404 code if bucket does not exist or 400 if bucket name
    less than 3 characters

schema.title: Response Removes Files From Minio Bucket Files Delete

post.description:
Allows getting datasets data with filters, sorts and pagination.

    Args:

        request: a request to get datasets data, schema for this request
        generated automatically.

    Returns:

        an array of datasets data

schema.title: Response Searches For Datasets Datasets Search Post

post.description:
Creates a new dataset object in database. If dataset with given name is already exists
then HTTPException 400 will be raised.

    Args:

        item: dataset model, has only "name" field which is str

    Returns:

        a message with a result of creating a dataset

    Raises:

        HTTPException 400 if dataset already exists

delete.description:
Deletes a dataset with a given name from a database. If that dataset does not exist
in a database, then  HTTPException 404 will be raised.

    Args:

        item: dataset model, has only "name" field which is str

    Returns:

        a message with a result of removing a dataset

    Raises:

        HTTPException 404 if dataset does not exist

post.summary: Searches For Files Inside Selected Dataset
post.description:
Takes a dataset name and returns all files metadata with this dataset.
Every object will be represented as dict.
If dataset with that doesn't exist HTTPException 404 will be raised.

    Args:

        dataset: str name of a Dataset's object

    Returns:

        List of metadata for all files that have relation
        with provided dataset.

    Raises:

        HTTPException 404 if dataset doesn't exist

schema.title: Response Searches For Files Inside Selected Dataset Datasets  Dataset  Files Search Post

get.summary: Get All Files By Dataset Id

schema.title: Response Get All Files By Dataset Id Datasets  Dataset Id  Files Get

post.summary: Gets Pairs Dataset Name - File Id
post.description:
Takes every bounded pair dataset-file and returns them.

    Args:

        request: a request to get bonds with a pagination.

    Returns:

        an array of bonds dataset-file

post.summary: Bounds Array Of Files To A Dataset
post.description:
Bounds file objects to a given dataset. If dataset does not exist HTTPException
404 will be raised. For each file result will be written into resulting dict.
If file doesn't exist or already bounded to that dataset it will be skipped.

    Args:

        name: str name of a dataset
        objects: list of file ids


    Returns:

        Array that contains result of bounding for each element

    Raises:

        HTTPException 404 if dataset does not exist

schema.title: Response Bounds Array Of Files To A Dataset Datasets Bonds Post

delete.summary: Removes Array Of Files From Dataset
delete.description:
Unbound file objects with a given dataset. If dataset does not exist HTTPException
404 will be raised. For each file result will be written into resulting dict.
If file doesn't exist or not bounded to that dataset it will be skipped.

    Args:

        item: FilesToDataset model that contains:
            objects: list of file ids
            name: str name of a dataset

    Returns:

        Array that contains result of un-bounding for each element

    Raises:

        HTTPException 404 if dataset does not exist

schema.title: Response Removes Array Of Files From Dataset Datasets Bonds Delete

post.description:
Provides uploading many files from one s3 bucket to MinIO

Args:

        access_key_id: storage access key
        secret_access_key: storage secret access key
        storage_url: storage endpoint. Example: "http://localhost:9000"
        bucket_s3: s3 storage bucket name from where files to be downloaded
        files_keys: list of files keys, paths to the file in s3 storage.
        bucket_storage: bucket in MinIO storage where files should be
        uploaded

schema.title: Response Downloads Files From S3 S3 Upload Post
